quantityRules.description: Ball pythons are solitary. House individually only - minimum 40 gallons for adults (36√ó18√ó12 inches).

setupTips: Provide multiple tight-fitting hides - ball pythons feel secure in snug spaces
Use under-tank heating or heat tape with thermostat
Maintain higher humidity than most snakes - crucial for proper shedding
notes: Very docile and handleable - rarely bite
Known for defensive curling into a ball when stressed
Can be picky eaters and may fast seasonally

warnings.message: Humidity is critical - maintain 50-60% normally, 65-75% during shed. Low humidity causes stuck sheds and respiratory issues.
Ball pythons are notorious for going off feed - don't panic if they refuse food seasonally. Monitor weight.

feedingRequirements: Carnivorous - feed appropriately sized frozen-thawed rats
Prey should be no wider than the widest part of snake's body
Prefer rats over mice as they grow - better nutrition
feedingSchedule: Hatchlings (0-12 months): Every 5-7 days, hopper mice or rat pups
Juveniles (1-3 years): Every 7-10 days, small to medium rats
Adults (3+ years): Every 10-14 days, medium to large rats
waterNotes: Provide large water bowl for drinking and soaking
Bowl must be large enough for snake to soak - important for shedding
mistingNotes: Regular misting needed to maintain 50-60% humidity
Mist daily or use automatic misting system
